com.github.mlefeb01.spigotutils.api.utils

Class TextUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mlefeb01.spigotutils.api.utils.TextUtils

  • public final class TextUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods to manipulate strings/format other data into easily readable formats

      • formatEnumAsString

        public static java.lang.String formatEnumAsString(java.lang.Enum enumeration)
        Formats an Enum by replacing underscores with spaces and capitalizing each word (e.g. - PIG_ZOMBIE to "Pig Zombie", IRON_GOLEM to "Iron Golem", SHEEP to "Sheep")
        Parameters:
        enumeration - enum
        Returns:
        formatted enum

      • formatCurrency

        public static java.lang.String formatCurrency(double currency)
        Formats a double currency into a readable format If the number is in the billions it will return how many billion with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 2.43B) If the number is in the millions it will return how many million with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 1.35M) If the number is in the thousands it will return how many thousand with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 100.34k) If the number is less than one thousand it will return the number with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 465.52)
        Parameters:
        currency - currency
        Returns:
        formatted currency

      • formatCurrency

        public static java.lang.String formatCurrency(long currency)
        Formats an int currency into a readable format If the number is in the billions it will return how many billion with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 2.43B) If the number is in the millions it will return how many million with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 1.35M) If the number is in the thousands it will return how many thousand with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 100.34k) If the number is less than one thousand it will return the number with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 465.52)
        Parameters:
        currency - currency
        Returns:
        formatted currency

      • formatCurrency

        public static java.lang.String formatCurrency(int currency)
        Formats an int currency into a readable format If the number is in the billions it will return how many billion with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 2.43B) If the number is in the millions it will return how many million with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 1.35M) If the number is in the thousands it will return how many thousand with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 100.34k) If the number is less than one thousand it will return the number with 2 decimal precision (e.g. - 465.52)
        Parameters:
        currency - currency
        Returns:
        formatted currency

        Returns:
        xd, xh, xm, xs

      • formatTimePast

        public static java.lang.String formatTimePast(long past)
        Formats the time passed in a readable format. This method should be used when something has already occurred and you want to format the time that has passed since
        Parameters:
        past - a time in the past
        Returns:
        xd, xh, xm, xs

      • formatTimeUntil

        public static java.lang.String formatTimeUntil(long end)
        Formats the time remaining until a time is reached as a readable format. This method should be used when something will occur in the future and you want to format the time remaining until
        Parameters:
        end - the stop time
        Returns:
        xd, xh, xm, xs

      • createProgressBar

        public static java.lang.String createProgressBar(double progress,
                                                 double goal,
                                                 int bars,
                                                 char barSymbol,
                                                 java.lang.String progressColor,
                                                 java.lang.String remainingColor)
        Creates a progress bar precondition: progress less than or equal to goal and goal greater than 0
        Parameters:
        progress - the current progress
        goal - the goal (max possible progress)
        bars - size of the progress bar
        barSymbol - the symbol to use for the bar
        progressColor - current progress color
        remainingColor - remaining progress color
        Returns:
        progress bar
